  • Constructor Details

    • Grid

      public Grid(int size, String commands)
      Initialize the grid
      Parameters:
      size - the dimension of the grid (N x N)
      commands - the commands in string

  • Method Details

    • initializeMap

      private void initializeMap()
      Initialize a heat map with values representing how many times a cell can still be visited

    • precomputeNeighbors

      private void precomputeNeighbors()
      Precompute valid neighbors for each cell using bitmasks. Each cell's neighbors are stored in a bitmask, allowing quick checks of connectivity.

    • inBounds

      private boolean inBounds(int row, int col)
      Check if the move is inbound
      Parameters:
      row - row index
      col - column index
      Returns:
      true if inbound. otherwise false

    • computeShortestDistancesToTarget

      private int[] computeShortestDistancesToTarget()
      Compute the Manhattan distance from every cell to the target cell (gridSize-1, 0).
      Returns:
      shortest distance to target cell

    • initializeShortestDistances

      private void initializeShortestDistances()
      Precompute the shortest Manhattan distances to the target cell (bottom-left corner). This information is used for pruning.

    • moveToPosition

      private int moveToPosition(int row, int col)
      Attempt to move into a given cell. Mark it as visited and decrement the count of how many times neighboring cells can be visited.
      Returns:
      a bitmask indicating which neighbors were affected.

    • undoMove

      private void undoMove(int row, int col, int originalValue, int directionBitmask)
      Undo a move performed by moveToPosition. Restores the original state.
      Parameters:
      row - row index
      col - column index
      originalValue - original value of the cell to undo to
      directionBitmask - affected direction of a move returned by moveToPosition

    • checkEnding

      private void checkEnding(int row, int col)
      If we have reached the final cell in the correct number of steps, increment the total path count if the final cell is the target cell.
      Parameters:
      row - row index
      col - column index

    • findTotalPaths

      public void findTotalPaths(int row, int col, int step)
      Recursively moving and backtracking to find all valid paths.
      Parameters:
      row - row index
      col - column index
      step - step index in the path

    • isValidMove

      private boolean isValidMove(int row, int col, int step)
      Check if a move is valid: the cell must be within bounds, unvisited, meet border constraints, and not lead to a dead end.
      Parameters:
      row - row index
      col - column index
      Returns:
      true if valid. otherwise false

    • isDeadEnd

      private boolean isDeadEnd(int row, int col)
      Detect dead ends where the path cannot continue. A dead end is defined here as certain blocked configurations of adjacent cells.
      Parameters:
      row - row index
      col - column index
      Returns:
      true if current cell leads to dead end. otherwise false

    • checkBorderConstraints

      private boolean checkBorderConstraints(int row, int col)
      Ensure that certain border constraints are met.
      Parameters:
      row - row index
      col - column index
      Returns:
      false if current cell violate constraints. otherwise true

    • canVisitAllRemainingCells

      private boolean canVisitAllRemainingCells(int row, int col, int step)
      Check if all remaining cells are reachable from the current cell by performing a BFS-like check using bitmasks. This is used to prune paths that cannot cover all cells.
      Parameters:
      row - row index
      col - column index
      step - current step index
      Returns:
      true if the path is able to cover all cells. otherwise false

    • getValidMoves

      private int getValidMoves(int row, int col, int step)
      Get a bitmask representing valid moves (up, down, left, right) from the current cell. If a cell with a value 1 is found, only that direction is considered valid.
      Parameters:
      row - row index
      col - column index
      step - current step index
      Returns:
      bitmask of valid directions

    • isManhattanValid

      private boolean isManhattanValid(int row, int col, int step)
      Determine if we should prune the search from the current cell at the given step. We prune if there are not enough steps left to reach the target.
      Parameters:
      row - row index
      col - column index
      step - current step index
      Returns:
      true if the current path still follow Manhattan algorithm. otherwise false
